intro: Matelea campechiana, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant is known for its large, velvety petals that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and partial shade. The plant's unique blooming habit and striking appearance make it a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
